title: Staircase

properties.name: description
properties.value: Staircases are found in buildings or houses with two or more stories. They may also be found leading downwards into dungeons. A staircase may simply be a row of steps, or it may be in the more ornate form of a spiral staircase. All staircases are climbed at the same speed (as they have no animation for climbing them) so the size differences are purely aesthetic.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:StaircaseThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Stairs

Staircases are found in buildings or houses with two or more stories. They may also be found leading downwards into dungeons. A staircase may simply be a row of steps, or it may be in the more ornate form of a spiral staircase. All staircases are climbed at the same speed (as they have no animation for climbing them) so the size differences are purely aesthetic.

When a player right-clicks a staircase they will usually be given three options based on whether they lead up as well as down: 'Climb', 'Climb-Up' and 'Climb-Down.' If a player chooses the climb-up or climb-down option their character will do just that, either progressing to the next floor or digressing to the floor below. If a player selects the 'Climb' option, or merely left-clicks the staircase, a message will appear. The message will ask the player to choose whether they wish to climb up or down the staircase.

New players may find that the first staircases they use are those in Lumbridge Castle, in the north-west and south-west corners. They are used to access the upper stories of the castle, including the bank there. In Tutorial Island, when it returned after the new Lumbridge Tutorial was removed, a glitch occurred where most stairs could not be used, along with many other changes.

Staircases bring characters up or down a level. Most of the time, you can see all or most levels using a graphic setting.

If you climb the set of stairs on the first level of the Heroes' Guild, you see an animation where your character actually climbs up the set of stairs.

Staircases in player-owned houses[edit | edit source]

Players may only build a staircase in certain rooms of their houses, namely the Quest Hall, the Skill Hall, and the Dungeon. The staircase in the Quest Hall or Skill Hall may be any of the following:

  • Oak staircase
  • Teak staircase
  • Spiral staircase
  • Marble staircase
  • Marble spiral

These types of staircases can be built depending on your level in Construction.

The staircase in a Dungeon must be below a Skill Hall staircase, a Quest Hall staircase, or a dungeon entrance in a Garden or Formal Garden.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Door
  • Ladder
  • Quest Hall
  • Dungeon
  • Oak staircase
  • Teak staircase
  • Spiral staircase
  • Marble staircase
  • Marble spiral
rawContent:
{{External|rs|rsc=Stairs}}
[[File:Staircases.png|thumb|220x220px]]
'''Staircases''' are found in buildings or houses with two or more stories. They may also be found leading downwards into [[dungeons]]. A staircase may simply be a row of steps, or it may be in the more ornate form of a [[spiral staircase]]. All staircases are climbed at the same speed (as they have no animation for climbing them) so the size differences are purely aesthetic.

When a player right-clicks a staircase they will usually be given three options based on whether they lead up as well as down: 'Climb', 'Climb-Up' and 'Climb-Down.' If a player chooses the climb-up or climb-down option their character will do just that, either progressing to the next floor or digressing to the floor below. If a player selects the 'Climb' option, or merely left-clicks the staircase, a message will appear. The message will ask the player to choose whether they wish to climb up or down the staircase.

New players may find that the first staircases they use are those in [[Lumbridge Castle]], in the north-west and south-west corners. They are used to access the upper stories of the castle, including the [[bank]] there. In [[Tutorial Island]], when it returned after the new Lumbridge Tutorial was removed, a [[glitch]] occurred where most stairs could not be used, along with many other changes.

Staircases bring characters up or down a level. Most of the time, you can see all or most levels using a graphic setting.

If you climb the set of stairs on the first level of the [[Heroes' Guild]], you see an animation where your character actually climbs up the set of stairs.

==Staircases in player-owned houses==
Players may only build a staircase in certain rooms of their [[Player-owned house|houses]], namely the [[Quest Hall]], the [[Skill Hall]], and the [[Dungeon (Construction)|Dungeon]]. The staircase in the Quest Hall or Skill Hall may be any of the following:

*[[Oak staircase]]
*[[Teak staircase]]
*[[Spiral staircase]]
*[[Marble staircase]]
*[[Marble spiral]]
These types of staircases can be built depending on your level in [[Construction]].

The staircase in a Dungeon must be below a Skill Hall staircase, a Quest Hall staircase, or a [[dungeon entrance]] in a [[Garden]] or [[Formal Garden]].

*[[Quest Hall]]
